{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Fikayo Tomori | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Oluwafikayomi Oluwadamilola Tomori{{cite web|title=FIFA U-20 World Cup Korea Republic 2017: List of Players|url=http://www.fifadata.com/document/FWYC/2017/pdf/FWYC_2017_SquadLists.pdf|publisher=[[FIFA]]|date=25 May 2017|accessdate=8 October 2017}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|12|19|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Fikayo Tomori |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/fikayo-tomori-252086/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=8 October 2017}} | birth_place = [[Calgary]], Canada | height = {{height|m=1.85}} | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2005–2016 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2016– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 1 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017 | clubs2 = → [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] (loan) | caps2 = 9 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017–2018 | clubs3 = → [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] (loan) | caps3 = 25 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] (loan) | caps4 = 24 | goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2016 | nationalteam1 = [[Canada men's national under-20 soccer team|Canada U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 15 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2017– | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 9 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 22:16, 9 January 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 18:30, 16 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Oluwafikayomi Oluwadamilola "Fikayo" Tomori''' (born 19 December 1997) is a professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[defender (association football)|defender]] for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Tomori joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at under-8 level and progressed through the clubs academy system.{{Cite news |title=Fikayo Tomori |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Fikayo_Tomori |publisher=TheChels.info}} He was part of the Chelsea youth side which recorded back to back triumphs in both the [[UEFA Youth League]] and the [[FA Youth Cup]] in 2015 and 2016. On 11 May 2016, Tomori was named upon the first-team substitute bench along with fellow academy players [[Tammy Abraham]] and [[Kasey Palmer]], in Chelsea's 1–1 draw with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. However, he failed to make an appearance at [[Anfield]].{{Cite news |title=Liverpool 1–1 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35738639 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 May 2016}} On 15 May 2016, in Chelsea's final game of the 2015/16 campaign, Tomori made his professional debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Premier League]] champions [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], replacing [[Branislav Ivanović]] in the 60th minute.{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 1–1 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240331 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2016}} Although Tomori was included in the United States pre-season tour, he did not make a single appearance.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/international/world/international-champions-cup/2016/north-america/r34980/ |title=Summary: International Champions Cup |accessdate=15 September 2016}} On 1 August 2016, Tomori signed a new four-year contract ahead of the 2016–17 campaign.{{Cite news |title=Tomori new deal on tour|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/07/tomori-signs-new-deal-on-tour.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=1 August 2016 |accessdate=1 August 2016}} On 12 August 2016, Tomori was handed the number 33 shirt prior to the season's beginning, switching from his previous number 43.{{cite web|title=Squad list announced|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/08/squad-list-announced.html|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=12 August 2015}} ====Loan to Brighton & Hove Albion==== On 23 January 2017, Tomori joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for the remainder of the [[2016–17 Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. season|2016–17]] campaign.{{Cite news |title=Albion sign Chelsea defender on loan |url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/brighton-hove-albion-chelsea-3535018.aspx |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion Official Site |date=23 January 2017 |accessdate=23 January 2017}} Five days later, Tomori made his Brighton debut in a 3–1 away defeat against [[National League (division)|National League]] side [[Lincoln City F.C.|Lincoln City]] in the [[FA Cup]] fourth round, in which he scored an own goal to give Lincoln the lead.{{Cite news |title=Lincoln City 3-1 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38700730 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}} On 18 February 2017, Tomori made his league debut for Brighton, in their 2–0 away victory against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]], replacing [[Anthony Knockaert]] in stoppage time of the second half.{{Cite news |title=Barnsley 0-2 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38940106 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 February 2017 |accessdate=23 February 2017}} On 18 March 2017, Tomori was given his first start for Brighton in their 2–0 away defeat against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], featuring for the entire 90 minutes.{{Cite news |title=Leeds United 2-0 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39239223 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 March 2017 |accessdate=20 March 2017}} ==== Loan to Hull City ==== On 31 August 2017, Tomori joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on a season long loan deal.{{cite news |title=Hull City sign Chelsea defender on loan |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/11015154/hull-city-sign-chelsea-defender-fikayo-tomori-on-season-long-loan |publisher=Sky Sports|date=31 August 2017 |accessdate=31 August 2017}} He made his debut on 13 September 2017, in a 2–1 defeat away to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41169976 | title = Fulham 2–1 Hull City | date = 13 September 2017 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = BBC | accessdate = 13 September 2017}} ==== Loan to Derby County ==== On 6 August 2018, Tomori joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Derby County FC|Derby County]] on a season long loan.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45088815|title=Fikayo Tomori: Chelsea defender joins Derby County on loan|date=6 August 2018|publisher=|accessdate=6 August 2018|work=BBC Sport}} He made his debut on 11 August in a 1-4 loss against [[Leeds United]].{{cite news |title=DERBY COUNTY VS LEEDS UNITED |url=https://www.leedsunited.com/derby |newspaper=Leeds United |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}}{{cite news |title=Derby 1-4 Leeds - Bielsa's side thrash Rams with brilliant attacking display |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/44797130 |newspaper=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} ==International career== Tomori is eligible to represent [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] at international level through his parents,{{cite news|url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2016/5/13/11669160/fikayo-tomori-chelsea-academy-first-team-canada|title=Chelsea teenager Fikayo Tomori turning heads on both sides of the Atlantic|author= David Paszto|publisher =Vox Media|date=13 May 2016|accessdate=11 July 2016}} Canada through his birth in Calgary and [[England national football team|England]] through his upbringing having lived in the country since he was a toddler.{{Cite news |title=Canada U-20 Fikayo Tomori named Chelsea FC's Academy Player of the Year |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2016/05/12/canada-youth-international-fikayo-tomori-turning-heads-chelsea-fc |publisher=MLS |date=14 May 2016}} ===Canadian national youth team=== On 27 March 2016, Tomori captained [[Canada men's national under-20 soccer team|Canada U20]] to a 2–1 victory over England U20 on his third appearance for the nation.{{Cite news |title=England Under-19s squad named for Mexico double header |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2016/may/england-under-19s-squad-named-for-mexico-150516 |publisher=TheFA |date=16 May 2016}} ===England national youth teams=== On 16 May 2016, in the next international break and a day after making his professional club debut, Tomori was called up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] squad. On 4 June 2016, Tomori made his England U19 debut in a 2–0 defeat against [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U20]]s, playing the full 90 minutes.{{Cite news |title=England Under-19s succumb to second-half goals in Mexico |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2016/jun/mexico-2-0-england-report-040616 |publisher=TheFA |date=4 June 2016 |accessdate=26 July 2016}} Tomori was also part of the England [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] squad which reached the semi-finals before being knocked out by [[Italy national under-19 football team|Italy]]. ==== 2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup ==== Tomori was selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. Tomori however scored an own goal in England's second group game against Guinea.{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/chelsea-transfer-news-blues-duo-fikayo-tomori-jake-clarkesalter-in-demand-after-englands-u20s-world-a3562451.html |title=Chelsea duo Fikayo Tomori and Jake Clarke-Salter in demand after England's U20s World Cup win |first=Simon |last=Johnson |work=Evening Standard |date=12 June 2017 | accessdate=13 June 2017}} Nevertheless, Tomori would help England beat Venezuela in the final 1–0, which is England's first win in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory of 1966.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title= Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |work=BBC Sport |date= 11 June 2017 | accessdate=13 June 2017}} ==Career statistics== total !60!!1!!4!!0!!4!!1!!2!!0!!70!!2 |} {{notelist}} == Honours == ;Chelsea Reserves * [[FA Youth Cup]]: [[2014–15 FA Youth Cup|2014–15]], [[2015–16 FA Youth Cup|2015–16]] * [[UEFA Youth League]]: [[2014–15 UEFA Youth League|2014–15]], [[2015–16 UEFA Youth League|2015–16]] ;Brighton & Hove Albion *'''[[EFL Championship]] runner up: [[2016-17 EFL Championship|2016-17]]''' ;England U20 *[[FIFA U-20 World Cup]]: [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2017]] '''Individual''' * [[UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|UEFA European U-19 Championship]] Team of the Tournament (1): [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2016]]{{cite web|title=Technical Reportfinals|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2016/technical-report/tr-under19-2016.pdf|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=24 October
